comment.body: bit.no is always great for testing if your content reached the no-tor part of the network

> 3-letter organizations infiltrating ZeroNet

FSF is comming…

---

NSA is just looking for some good porn

> If anything, they'd be more worried about the various meshnets popping up, since those have been used to get around government surveillance and censorship.

Speaking of this, I should definitely try to join FreiFunk now that I have tor running.

There seem to be already 2 in my dorm, so …

@musickiller: Well I know one thing from diaspora*, as an ‘oldtimer’ you are more likely to overlook new features, since you already have your established workflow. (even there I feel pretty new, it's running since '10 and I'm there since '11)
The version system is confusing. People who use 3.5 get told, they use an outdated version, despite that's actually the last stable release
The chat has a visitor counter, it’s probably the seeds

> [p2p](#comment_2_13Z7XxTa7JuFat3KzzMWu3onwM6biLuurJ): last stable release should be 3.63.5 is really outdated.

https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/releases

3.6 is in development
oh, then he is about to develop 3.7 now?
*Best way* is to clone the git repo, you can then use `git stash` easy backup and merging. Which falls back to manual merging if merging errors occure.
